title: Mining giant Fortescue says it's time to walk away from the 'proven fantasy' of net zero
content: Fortescue, the world's fourth-largest iron ore miner, has outlined plans to stop burning fossil fuels across its Australian iron ore operations by 2030.
summary: Fortescue, the world's fourth-largest iron ore miner, has outlined plans to stop burning fossil fuels across its Australian iron ore operations by 2030.

title: Israel retaliation may target Iran oil infrastructure, boosting prices further, Wall Street analysts say
content: For months, traders have largely dismissed the risk of a supply disruption in the Middle East, but the threat is growing.
summary: For months, traders have largely dismissed the risk of a supply disruption in the Middle East, but the threat is growing.

title: As Netanyahu vows Iran payback, markets watch for dangers of further escalation
content: Markets are braced for a potential Israeli response after Tehran's missile attack, with up to 4% of global oil supply at risk if Iran's infrastructure is hit.
summary: Markets are braced for a potential Israeli response after Tehran's missile attack, with up to 4% of global oil supply at risk if Iran's infrastructure is hit.

title: OpenAI closes funding at $157 billion valuation, as Microsoft, Nvidia, SoftBank join round
content: OpenAI closed its long-awaited funding round, announcing that it raised $6.6 billion at a $157 billion post-money valuation.
summary: OpenAI closed its long-awaited funding round, announcing that it raised $6.6 billion at a $157 billion post-money valuation.

title: Tesla stock slips after EV maker misses estimates on deliveries
content: Tesla's third-quarter deliveries report follows a rally in the stock price over the past few months.
summary: Tesla's third-quarter deliveries report follows a rally in the stock price over the past few months.

title: Oil watchers now see a real threat of supply disruptions after latest Iran-Israel escalation
content: Oil watchers are now factoring in a genuine threat to crude supplies after Iran launched a barrage of missiles on Israel.
summary: Oil watchers are now factoring in a genuine threat to crude supplies after Iran launched a barrage of missiles on Israel.

title: Ireland reveals how it plans to spend ‘transformational’ $14 billion Apple tax windfall
content: Ireland's government has outlined how it intends to deploy more than $14 billion in back taxes from Apple.
summary: Ireland's government has outlined how it intends to deploy more than $14 billion in back taxes from Apple.

title: China stock ETFs rip higher even as mainland markets close for holiday
content: Exchange-traded funds overseas that track Chinese stocks continued their rally Wednesday even as mainland markets were shut for a week-long holiday.
summary: Exchange-traded funds overseas that track Chinese stocks continued their rally Wednesday even as mainland markets were shut for a week-long holiday.

title: Michael Jordan's 23XI Racing team sues NASCAR and CEO Jim France
content: Michael Jordan's racing team and fellow team Front Row Motorsports said NASCAR has used anticompetitive practices to prevent fair compensation in the sport.
summary: Michael Jordan's racing team and fellow team Front Row Motorsports said NASCAR has used anticompetitive practices to prevent fair compensation in the sport.

title: LVMH and Formula One announce 10-year partnership
content: Liberty Media-owned Formula One and luxury giant LVMH are entering into a 10-year partnership, according to a joint press release from Wednesday afternoon.
summary: Liberty Media-owned Formula One and luxury giant LVMH are entering into a 10-year partnership, according to a joint press release from Wednesday afternoon.

title: Facebook owner Meta forms data-sharing pact with UK banks to counter scams
content: Meta is working with U.K. banks NatWest and Metro Bank on an information-sharing agreement to help them prevent customers from falling victim to fraud.
summary: Meta is working with U.K. banks NatWest and Metro Bank on an information-sharing agreement to help them prevent customers from falling victim to fraud.

title: Red-hot refinance demand retreats after tiny bump higher in mortgage rates
content: Mortgage rates moved ever so slightly higher last week, but it was enough to take a little heat out of what had been a briefly red-hot refinance market.
summary: Mortgage rates moved ever so slightly higher last week, but it was enough to take a little heat out of what had been a briefly red-hot refinance market.

title: Goldman-backed Starling Bank fined $38.5 million for 'shockingly lax' financial crime controls
content: London's Financial Conduct Authority said it has fined Starling "for financial crime failings related to its financial sanctions screening."
summary: London's Financial Conduct Authority said it has fined Starling "for financial crime failings related to its financial sanctions screening."

title: Yale's Stephen Roach: Markets are in danger of being 'whipsawed' by Middle East conflict, U.S. unemployment
content: "We are likely to see significant increases in volatility and markets that really are whipped back and forth dramatically," Roach told CNBC's "Squawk Box Asia."
summary: "We are likely to see significant increases in volatility and markets that really are whipped back and forth dramatically," Roach told CNBC's "Squawk Box Asia."

title: Hong Kong stocks rally over 6% in sixth straight day of gains
content: Asia-Pacific markets were mixed on Wednesday, following a poor start to the trading month on Wall Street.
summary: Asia-Pacific markets were mixed on Wednesday, following a poor start to the trading month on Wall Street.

title: China property stocks surge to highest levels in a year as stimulus rally continues
content: Shares of most Hong Kong-listed Chinese property stocks surged to their highest in over a year, as China's recent slew of stimulus continue to buoy markets.
summary: Shares of most Hong Kong-listed Chinese property stocks surged to their highest in over a year, as China's recent slew of stimulus continue to buoy markets.

title: China says it filed an appeal to WTO over Canada's tariffs on EVs and metals
content: Canada announced in August that it would impose 100% import tariffs on China-made EVs.
summary: Canada announced in August that it would impose 100% import tariffs on China-made EVs.

title: Young Chinese are 'retiring' in the countryside as China's unemployment woes grate
content: China's youths are retreating to the countryside after getting fired from their jobs, or unable to secure one that they are content with.
summary: China's youths are retreating to the countryside after getting fired from their jobs, or unable to secure one that they are content with.

title: China's economic woes dampen 'Golden Week' holiday travel
content: Not only have flights been cheaper, data also indicates that travelers may be opting for lower cost transport options.
summary: Not only have flights been cheaper, data also indicates that travelers may be opting for lower cost transport options.

title: India to fabricate its first chip in two years as Nvidia, AMD and Micron pledge to expand to the country
content: India will fabricate its first chip in two years, Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal told CNBC during a one-on-one interview with CNBC in New York.
summary: India will fabricate its first chip in two years, Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal told CNBC during a one-on-one interview with CNBC in New York.

title: Bitcoin tumbles back to the $60,000 level as tensions in the Middle East rise
content: Bitcoin has had a shaky start to what is usually one of its strongest months, sliding back to $60,000.
summary: Bitcoin has had a shaky start to what is usually one of its strongest months, sliding back to $60,000.

title: Port strike could reignite inflation, with larger economic impact dependent on how long it lasts
content: Manufacturers of everything from trucks to toys to artificial Christmas trees face obstacles now that the ILA has called a stoppage.
summary: Manufacturers of everything from trucks to toys to artificial Christmas trees face obstacles now that the ILA has called a stoppage.

title: A historic strike is underway at U.S. ports — and the impact on global supply chains could be huge
content: A massive dockworker strike at seaports on the U.S. East and Gulf coasts is expected to wreak havoc on global supply chains and the economy.
summary: A massive dockworker strike at seaports on the U.S. East and Gulf coasts is expected to wreak havoc on global supply chains and the economy.

title: Nike withdraws guidance, postpones investor day as it gears up for CEO change
content: Nike on Tuesday said it was withdrawing its full-year guidance and postponing its investor day as it gears up for a new CEO to take the helm.
summary: Nike on Tuesday said it was withdrawing its full-year guidance and postponing its investor day as it gears up for a new CEO to take the helm.

title: NATO's new chief will have to confront threats outside the alliance — and within
content: As Mark Rutte becomes NATO's new General Secretary, his leadership skills will be put to the test quickly as the bloc confronts external and internal threats.
summary: As Mark Rutte becomes NATO's new General Secretary, his leadership skills will be put to the test quickly as the bloc confronts external and internal threats.

title: European markets close lower as investors eye Middle East tensions; oil prices jump 4%
content: European stocks closed lower Tuesday, erasing earlier gains amid heightened fears of a possible attack on Israel by Iran.
summary: European stocks closed lower Tuesday, erasing earlier gains amid heightened fears of a possible attack on Israel by Iran.

title: Port strike fallout: Blockbuster weight-loss drug supply from Wegovy to Ozempic, Mounjaro, Zepbound, caught up in East Coast trade shutdown
content: High demand for blockbuster weight-loss drugs such as Ozempic and Mounjaro is being tested by a ports strike hitting import hubs for Novo Nordisk and Eli Lilly.
summary: High demand for blockbuster weight-loss drugs such as Ozempic and Mounjaro is being tested by a ports strike hitting import hubs for Novo Nordisk and Eli Lilly.

title: Saudi Arabia slashes growth forecasts, sees wider budget deficits
content: Saudi Arabia's real GDP is expected to grow 0.8% this year, a dramatic drop from a previous estimate of 4.4%, according to the latest government figures.
summary: Saudi Arabia's real GDP is expected to grow 0.8% this year, a dramatic drop from a previous estimate of 4.4%, according to the latest government figures.

title: Mastercard to buy Swedish startup that makes it easier to manage and cancel subscription plans
content: The payments giant touted the deal as a way to help consumers with a key pain point — managing the myriad subscription services that exist today.
summary: The payments giant touted the deal as a way to help consumers with a key pain point — managing the myriad subscription services that exist today.

title: Abu Dhabi's ADNOC to acquire German chemicals firm Covestro for $16.4 billion
content: Abu Dhabi's state oil firm ADNOC announced it will buy German firm Covestro in a 14.7 billion-euro deal ($16.4 billion).
summary: Abu Dhabi's state oil firm ADNOC announced it will buy German firm Covestro in a 14.7 billion-euro deal ($16.4 billion).
